forecast.name: Today
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Snow Showers then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of snow showers before 8am, then a slight chance of rain showers between 8am and 2pm. Partly sunny. High near 40, with temperatures falling to around 34 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 25. Northwest wind 3 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
Dawn breaks over Boston, painting the sky in soft whispers of lavender and gray. There's a slight chill in the air, a crisp reminder of the season, with temperatures teetering just above freezing. This morning, the city is graced with a touch of uncertainty—a slight chance of snow showers lingers in the early hours, giving way, perhaps, to the gentle dance of raindrops by mid-morning. As the day unfolds, the clouds will part just enough to allow the sun to peek through, ushering in a partly sunny respite, though the afternoon will see temperatures sinking to a cooler embrace.

As you navigate the brisk streets, a warm layer is advisable, perhaps a cozy knit sweater under a reliable coat, accompanied by a sturdy scarf against the northwest winds that promise to whip and gust, reminding you of winter’s tenacity. It’s a good day for a quiet walk among the frosted trees or a moment spent sipping a warm drink at a favorite café, watching the world pass gently by. While the day may not spark flamboyant outdoor adventures, it carries a comfort of routine, an invitation to indulge in the simplicity of life.
